speaker: AGENT
line: Radio check. Perimeter is clear.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Copy that. Give me a check every ten.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Why don't you folks make yourselves comfortable? Watch some television, get some rest. Try to put your minds at ease. Just try to stay away from the windows and doors, if you would.

speaker: MRS. SCOBIE
line: Do we have to ask you if we can use the bathroom? I feel like I'm a prisoner in my own home.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Ma'am, I apologize for the imposition but my job is to protect you. As of this evening, the FBI's top priority is keeping you safe.

speaker: MRS. SCOBIE
line: For how long? A week? A month? Then what?

speaker: MRS. SCOBIE
line: Jim, don't do this, please. You don't have to testify. It's not worth it. These people have a long reach. They're powerful.

speaker: JIM SCOBIE
line: I have to do this.

speaker: MRS. SCOBIE
line: I'm going to bed.

speaker: JIM SCOBIE
line: Thank you.

speaker: SKINNER
line: The Grand Jury convenes at 9:00. We'll leave here at 7:30. I'll be right outside the door if you need me.

speaker: MRS. SCOBIE
line: Jim? Jim? Are you feeling all right?

speaker: MRS. SCOBIE
line: Jim? Mr. Skinner... Mr. Skinner! Jim?!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Dr. Scobie?

speaker: MRS. SCOBIE
line: Jim!

speaker: WATER AGENT
line: Ma'am...

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yes, at the time, I was in another part of the house. Yes... Yes, sir... Yes, sir. Yes, sir, I will have answers for you, I...

speaker: MULDER
line: Rough night?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Oh, it's shaping up to be a rougher morning. Follow me.

speaker: SKINNER
line: There's fingerprints everywhere but as they all belong to the deceased and his wife they don't help us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is where the body was found?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: What can you tell us about him?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Dr. James Scobie, age 44. R&D biochemist with Morley tobacco. If he were alive as of … … 26 minutes ago he'd be giving testimony against his former employer before a federal grand jury.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Testimony concerning what?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Not even his wife or his lawyer know the specifics, only that it concerns research that he was involved in potentially extremely damaging to Morley... enough so that Scobie received death threats. Given the high-profile nature of the case the Director charged me with insuring Dr. Scobie's protection.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And you think that someone made good on these threats?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I do. And we've yet to determine how someone got in here, or... what killed him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can't blow the whistle with a mouth like that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's almost as if his flesh has been stripped or eaten away. I mean, an assailant could have thrown acid on him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, if it was acid in the face he would have screamed bloody murder.

speaker: SKINNER
line: We're looking at all possibilities, Agent. We need answers, we don't have a lot of time and we're going up against one of the biggest corporations in America. The Director himself personally instructed me that he wants this case closed as swiftly as possible. I trust I can count on your help.

speaker: SKINNER
line: All right, I want you to perform the autopsy. The body's in the county morgue.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll get right on it.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Huh.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: There's no ashtrays. Dr. Scobie and his wife don't smoke?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Not that I've witnessed.

speaker: MULDER
line: A tobacco employee that doesn't smoke-- Isn't that kind of like a GM executive who drives a Ford? If this was a hit it seems unnecessarily high-profile. It kind of draws attention to itself, don't you think?

speaker: SKINNER
line: That could be the point-- to intimidate potential witnesses. Scobie had a supervisor at Morley-- a Dr. Peter Voss. I want to talk to him.

speaker: MULDER
line: You mind if I tag along?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No.

speaker: AGENT
line: Sir, would you take a look at this?

speaker: SKINNER
line: What have you got?

speaker: SKINNER
line: We're here to see Dr. Voss.

speaker: SECURITY MAN
line: Do you have an appointment?

speaker: SECURITY MAN
line: Do you have an appointment?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Maybe you missed this the first time around.

speaker: DAVID BRIMLEY
line: Gentlemen, I can help you. Daniel Brimley, head of Corporate Security. A pleasure.

speaker: DAVID BRIMLEY
line: You're here concerning Dr. Scobie's death, I take it.

speaker: SKINNER
line: We are.

speaker: DAVID BRIMLEY
line: We're all extremely sorry to hear about it. Jim has a lot of friends in this building.

speaker: MULDER
line: Really? No hard feelings that he was about to turn federal witness against your company?

speaker: DAVID BRIMLEY
line: Nobody was happy about Jim's decision but the timing of his death couldn't have been worse.

speaker: SKINNER
line: So you have problem with us speaking to Dr. Voss?

speaker: DAVID BRIMLEY
line: Absolutely not. Whatever we can do to help. Please.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: Could you, um...

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: Would you give my sincerest condolences to Jim's wife, Joan? How is she?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sure she'll take comfort in finding out why her husband died.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Dr. Voss, can you enlighten us as to what Dr. Scobie intended to tell the grand jury? We know it had to do with company research.

speaker: LEAD COUNSEL
line: I'm sorry. Dr. Voss would be in violation of his employment confidentiality clause in answering that question.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Dr. Scobie was your friend?

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: Yeah, for 14 years, mm-hmm.

speaker: SKINNER
line: And yet you demoted him five weeks ago. You took him off a particular project. Can you tell us why that happened?

speaker: LEAD COUNSEL
line: As before, Dr. Voss would be in violation of his confidentiality clause in answering questions regarding the nature of his work here at Morley. I'm sure you understand our cooperation cannot extend itself to revealing corporate secrets.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm not sensing any "cooperation" whatsoever. In fact, I'm one more non-answer away from getting a federal warrant and searching this entire building.

speaker: LEAD COUNSEL
line: Then this meeting is over. Dr. Voss.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr. Voss... can you tell me what that is?

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: It's a tobacco beetle. Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: We found it at Jim Scobie's house.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: Well, you'll find a lot of these around here. They're everywhere. There's probably a dozen in the grill of your car right now.

speaker: LEAD COUNSEL
line: May I ask where you're going with this, Agent?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry, I can't. Answering that question would violate FBI confidentiality due to the sensitive nature of our investigation.

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: Evenin'.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: What are you doing here?

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: Run out of smokes. Me and Dr. Scobie had an arrangement, as you know. So I figured, uh... Dr. Scobie not being around that my arrangement with him... slides on over to you.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: Here you go.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: That won't hold me.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: I'll-I'll bring you more. Just-just-just don't come here anymore, all right?

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: It seems everybody's acting funny around me all of a sudden, you know? Telling me not to talk to stay away from their houses? Huh. Too bad about Dr. Scobie, huh?

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: Yeah...

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: I bet people are wondering how he died, huh? I've been working my own theory up in the old noggin. I'd be happy to share it with you someday.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: I think that you should leave now.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Yeah. I don't want to wear out my welcome. We'll be seeing a lot of each other, I expect.

speaker: MULDER
line: Smoke 'em if you got 'em.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What have you found?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, the tissue damage on Dr. Scobie's mouth extends all the way down his trachea into his lungs. His alveoli look like corned beef.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What about this being the result of some sort of corrosive agent?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, that's not the case. There's no acids present, no caustics. This damage isn't the result of any kind of chemical reaction. His airways have more or less just been reamed out. I can tell you what killed him, though... strictly speaking.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hypoxemia. The, uh, inability to transfer oxygen from the lungs to the bloodstream.

speaker: SKINNER
line: He choked to death.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I mean, this damage-- however it was accomplished, someone did do this to him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, not necessarily. There weren't any signs of struggle in the room. Maybe no one was ever there.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Where are you going with this?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that this isn't a homicide. You... examined the body Scully. Did you... find any of these?

speaker: SCULLY
line: A bug?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, it's a, tobacco beetle, yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I didn't find anything like that, Mulder. Were you expecting me to?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Killer bugs? This is what I'm supposed to tell the Director?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know but judging from Dr. Voss's reaction to this I think it's the thing we should investigate.

speaker: NEIGHBOR
line: Hey, I've been telling you all week! How many times I got to say it? No smoking! You hear me?

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: America, man! E. Pluribus, uh...

speaker: NEIGHBOR
line: I'll get you kicked out, you son of a bitch! You think I'm kidding? I'll do it!

speaker: NEIGHBOR
line: The law's on my side.

speaker: MULDER
line: Guests check in, but they don't check out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh... Well, judging from the condition of the body, I'd say that he died in the same manner as Dr. Scobie.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Except this man's no corporate whistle blower. "Thomas Gastall." Out-of- date Massachusetts license... food coupons... and a certificate of completion for a court- ordered anger-management class.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What could Morley Tobacco have against a transient from Massachusetts?

speaker: MULDER
line: Probably nothing.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What are you suggesting, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: That Jim Scobie wasn't murdered. Neither was this man.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, then what killed them?

speaker: MULDER
line: These.

speaker: SKINNER
line: We didn't find any insects in Dr. Scobie's bathroom.

speaker: MULDER
line: But there was an open window through which they could have escaped.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's a long shot, Mulder, but it could be some form of contagious agent, like an insect-borne bacterium which would mean that there might be other victims in this building.

speaker: MULDER
line: FBI.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sorry to wake you.

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: You, you didn't wake me.

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: Come on in.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you. We're investigating the death of a man who lived right next to you-- a Thomas Gastall. Do you know him?

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: I knew his voice. He yelled a lot.

speaker: MULDER
line: He yelled?

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: Yeah. He said I smoked too much. Whatcha gonna to do, man? It's a free country. E. Pluribus, uh...

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: You mind?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. You don't seem surprised that he's dead.

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: Guess his number come up. Just glad it wasn't me.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is your name, sir?

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: Daryl Weaver.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr. Weaver, did you see or hear anything unusual last night?

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: Little Korean fellow down the hall. Dresses like wonder woman. But that's every night.

speaker: MULDER
line: Other than that?

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: Say, there wouldn't happen to be, uh... any reward money involved would there? I mean, I could use an extra buck or two.

speaker: MULDER
line: The FBI would appreciate your voluntary cooperation, sir. That's the way it works.

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: Ain't that always the way? Nope. My mind is, uh, just drawing a complete blank.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's my card. Thank you, Mr. Weaver.

speaker: MULDER
line: Anything?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Two deaths in less than 24 hours. We're no closer to an answer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And the only thing I have to go on medically at this point is Mulder's bug. You know, I know an entomologist at UNC Wilmington-- Dr. Libby Nance.

speaker: MULDER
line: Good. Talk to her.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Where are you going?

speaker: MULDER
line: See about something else that's been bugging me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Voss?

speaker: ANNE VOSS
line: Yes?

speaker: MULDER
line: Fox Mulder. Is your husband home?

speaker: ANNE VOSS
line: Um...

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: It's okay, honey. It's okay. It will just be a minute.

speaker: ANNE VOSS
line: Sure thing.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: I really shouldn't be talking to you without our lawyers.

speaker: MULDER
line: I understand your reluctance to talk, sir. You have a nice family-- a lot to lose.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: What do you want, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: There's been another victim-- Thomas Gastall. Died exactly the same way Scobie did.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: I'm sorry to hear that. But what's that got to do with me?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, we found these all over him. I believe that that's what killed both men.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: Tobacco beetle. It's an herbivore. It eats tobacco. Hence its name.

speaker: MULDER
line: I... I understand that, but... maybe these don't.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: I'm not really required to talk to you, am I?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. But why are you hiding behind your lawyers, doctor? How many people have to die before you do the right thing?

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: I'll get it. Hello?

speaker: DAVID BRIMLEY
line: What did he want?

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: Are you spying on me?

speaker: DAVID BRIMLEY
line: I'm not spying on you, Peter. I'm looking out for you. What did he want?

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: There's been another death. Downtown.

speaker: DAVID BRIMLEY
line: How did it happen?

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: I don't know. I don't know. This has gone on long enough. We should come forward. I should.

speaker: DAVID BRIMLEY
line: Do you hear what you're saying, Peter? Now, I want you to just take a moment. I want you to think about what really matters to you. Now, tell me where I can find Darrel Weaver.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: Why?

speaker: DAVID BRIMLEY
line: This was my mistake. I'll clean it up.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: I don't know where he is.

speaker: DR. LIBBY NANCE
line: This doesn't make sense.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What doesn't make sense?

speaker: DR. LIBBY NANCE
line: Well, it's a lasioderma serricorne-- a tobacco beetle. Only... I've never seen one exactly like this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hmm. What are the differences?

speaker: DR. LIBBY NANCE
line: Physical differences-- uh... minor but definitely notable. Deviations in the mandibles, the antennae, the body segmentation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What if such deviations arose from genetic engineering?

speaker: DR. LIBBY NANCE
line: Engineering the bugs themselves?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. I was thinking about another possibility: "Transgenomics."

speaker: SKINNER
line: Which is...?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's a form of DNA manipulation-- alterations made on the genetic level.

speaker: DR. LIBBY NANCE
line: It is pretty widely known that tobacco companies have been pouring money into that kind of research-- changing the tobacco plant itself in order to make it heartier, give it less nicotine, more nicotine, make it naturally menthol-flavored... you name it.

speaker: SKINNER
line: A form of what-- "super tobacco"?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Which possibly could have created super bugs. I guess the real question is could they have become dangerous to humans?

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: Mr. Weaver! Mr. Weaver?

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: Sorry, doc, no vacancy.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: What happened there?

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: Well, you tell me. You're the one with the Ph.D. I'm just a big old guinea pig.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: Now, listen... um... You have to leave town.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: And give up all this? Me not doing my part for science?

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: Here. Take it. It's everything I have in the bank. $4,000.

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: It's not much, but, uh... It's a start.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: Wait, wait a minute. I'm not kidding. You got to get out of here.

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: Why? I got a good thing going here. I got cash money. I got all the coffin nails I can suck down. Although... lately, I've been thinking this particular brand … it doesn't, um... do anyone else any favors-- healthwise.

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: You've been thinking that, too, huh?

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: Would it bother you if I lit one up?

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: Toodles.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: No, you... You don't understand. Morley is a multi-billion-dollar global corporation. You think they're going to let you endanger that, huh? They'll kill you first.

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: Sounds like a Darrel Weaver problem to me.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: Yeah.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What am I looking at?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thomas Gastall's left lung and bronchus.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, I guess that explains where the beetles came from.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey, Mulder. Where have you been?

speaker: MULDER
line: Talking to lawyers over at Justice. Trying to get a look at Morley's files.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, take a look at this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They're the larval stage of the tobacco beetle, Mulder and somehow, they have ended up nesting in Thomas Gastall's lungs.

speaker: SKINNER
line: But what doesn't make any sense is why Scobie's lungs didn't show this same condition.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The larvae must pupate inside the lungs and then once they mature into beetles exit the body en masse.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, that explains the condition of the face and throat.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Only, how do they get into the lungs to begin with?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: SKINNER
line: How is he?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They're using a deep-suction technique that's been designed for asthma and cystic fibrosis. And, so far, we're having some luck at clearing his lungs.

speaker: SKINNER
line: But...?

speaker: SCULLY
line: For every one of those things that are in his lung tissue there may be a dozen eggs that have yet to be hatched.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Eggs?

speaker: SCULLY
line: His pulmonary tissue is riddled with them and they're going to hatch. It's just... … we're buying time.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, how did this happen? These eggs-- how did they get into his lungs?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm thinking he inhaled them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, the tobacco beetle lives out its life cycle on or around the tobacco plant. That's where it lays its eggs. If those genetically-altered beetles that we found did that then maybe the eggs survived the processing into cigarettes.

speaker: SKINNER
line: And been carried into Mulder's lungs as smoke?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Right-- like spores or pollen, somehow small enough to be airborne.

speaker: SKINNER
line: But Mulder isn't a smoker, and neither was Scobie.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe they were around someone who was.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Don't bother calling security.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Federal search warrant, as promised.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Do it.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're going to talk to me, Doctor. One of my agents is dying of the same thing that killed Dr. Scobie. I believe you have information that can save him.

speaker: LEAD COUNSEL
line: We stand by our contention that any and all such information is proprietary, and is therefore the sole property of Morley Tobacco.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You listen to me, you son of a bitch. This isn't about Morley or your precious research. This is about saving lives.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: That's exactly what we were trying to do.

speaker: LEAD COUNSEL
line: Dr. Voss, I'm advising you not to speak.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: This has gone on long enough.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: We thought we were doing a good thing. We knew people were never going to stop smoking no matter how unhealthy it was so why not genetically engineer a safer cigarette?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Except you engineered the bugs, as well.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: We recruited test smokers. We conducted focus groups. There were no problems. And, um... after a few months in, things... things got bad. We had four test subjects and, uh... three of them died.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Is that what Dr. Scobie was going to testify about?

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: Yeah. Yeah. And the company wanted us to keep it quiet. I thought, let's correct the mistakes and face the consequences. Jim didn't. He was monitoring the focus group, and that's... that's how he got infected.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You said only three died. Who was the fourth?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Clear.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: He told me he meant to get Weaver.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Looks like Weaver got to him first.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Mr. Brimley can you hear me?

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: You got Mickey's Big Mouth?

speaker: CLERK
line: There's no smoking in here.

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: Mickey's Big Mouth.

speaker: CLERK
line: Anything else? Carton of cigarettes?

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: You don't have my brand.

speaker: DEPUTY'S RADIO
line: This is code 4148. … 81 clear. 8814 clear.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mmm. It must be bad.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do you feel?

speaker: MULDER
line: Like a dust buster attacked me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We're looking for someone who may be able to help you-- a Morley test subject by the name of Darrel Weaver.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr. "E pluribus…"

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. Mr. Weaver seems to have some kind of tolerance or immunity and we're hoping that once we find him we'll be able to figure out how to treat you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Doctor!

speaker: SCULLY
line: His SAT's down to 72. Get some O-2 on him and call the Code.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Susan, Code Blue!

speaker: NURSE SUSAN
line: Right, Doctor.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Over to my side.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Dr. Scully? We've got him stabilized on ECMO for the moment but we're not going to be able to maintain him on it for long. Of course, you see why.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's more now than there were six hours ago.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: They're beginning to block the flow of blood. Our best bet is to go back in there. I think this time, we have to crack the chest.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. No, I... He's too weak for thoracic surgery. He-he'd die on the table.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: I don't know what our other options are.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'd say for the time being, we just wait.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: That'll definitely kill him. Sooner or later.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Mrs. Voss, I'm Assistant Director Walter Skinner with the FBI. May we come in?

speaker: ANNE VOSS
line: What is this? What's going on?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I have to ask for your cooperation. These men are here to protect you and your family.

speaker: ANNE VOSS
line: Oh, my God. Why?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Your husband hasn't spoken to you about this?

speaker: ANNE VOSS
line: He's not here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: He told me he was headed home. Try Dr. Voss at work.

speaker: ANNE VOSS
line: I-I've just been trying. There's no answer.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: Behind you.

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: I was just leaving. I got what I came for.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: He took the test cigarettes. I couldn't stop him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Stop right there!

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: Why? You gonna shoot me?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm not going to let you go infect more people.

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: You're going to let me do whatever I want to do. Dr. Voss here tells me you need me. You need me to save your boy.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Don't do it.

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: They say these things kill people, you know? Any brand, sooner or later. But you know, it doesn't have to be that way. I think Dr. Voss is really onto something with his research. I do.

speaker: DR. PETER VOSS
line: It's over, Weaver. I'm through.

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: Oh... Come on, now. I mean... you gotta figure... the first, um, car killed a bunch of people before they perfected it 'cause it's all just part of the scientific process, you know?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Mr. Weaver, I will shoot you.

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: No, you won't.

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: I'm a regular damn scientific marvel. They, uh... study me, they're gonna, uh... write scientific papers about me... I could be the cure for cancer. Me, Darrel Weaver.

speaker: DARYL WEAVER
line: You ain't gonna shoot me. Toodles.

speaker: SKINNER
line: How's Mulder?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not good. Let's get the blood work on this man.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Get me 30 milligrams of methyl pyrrolidinyl pyridine.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Nicotine?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. I think this could save Mulder's life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey. Good to be back?

speaker: MULDER
line: Beats the alternative.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, you'll be interested to know that Morley Tobacco has subpoenaed all of our files on the case. They seem extremely interested in your recovery.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about Darrel Weaver?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's, uh, well enough to have been moved to the hospital ward at Raleigh Correctional.

speaker: MULDER
line: It was the nicotine itself that was keeping him alive?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, his fingertips were stained yellow with it. He was a four-pack-a-day smoker-- far heavier than any of the focus group members who died. You know, nicotine is extremely poisonous. It's actually one of the oldest known insecticides.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's good for killing tobacco beetles.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, once we loaded your system up with enough of it, it acted as a sort of chemotherapy... except it almost stopped your breathing at the same time.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's not all it did.

speaker: MULDER
line: I bought these on the way to work.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're not going to start smoking.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, they say the addiction is stronger than heroin.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Good. Well, Skinner's waiting for us in his office.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll be right up.
